text:
That’s very true! Escape’s been so liberal with its briefs that I’m actually seeking out stricter work more than finding time for the really creative stuff. I’ve no doubt that’ll swap very quickly but I’m trying to strike a healthy balance while I’ve got control.

I didn’t realise the distinction at MPC was that significant. How is unionisation in the industry? As far as I know, not good, but not much beyond that. It’s something I do tend to worry about.

That makes sense. OOU sounds like a great place to work and certainly not an opportunity worth sacrificing for DNEG’s offering. Pay-wise, that’s a huge difference. 

I can’t wait to show them to you! I’m so proud of how the films have gone so far, how my teams have done, and the state of the films even as they are now. I’ll get them to you as soon as I can.
